meanings.definition: Relating to the branch of medicine that deals with the incidence, distribution, and control of diseases.
meanings.sent1: The epidemiological report analyzed the spread of the flu in our town.
meanings.sent2: Researchers conducted an epidemiological study to track the source of the outbreak.
meanings.sent3: The epidemiological approach to understanding illnesses can be quite enlightening.
meanings.sent4: Her keen epidemiological skills helped her identify the root cause of the infection.
meanings.sent5: The epidemiological data painted a clear picture of the disease's impact on the community.

meanings.definition: Involving the study of the patterns, causes, and effects of health and disease conditions in defined populations.
meanings.sent1: An epidemiological investigation revealed the link between pollution and respiratory issues.
meanings.sent2: The team used epidemiological methods to analyze the health trends in the region.
meanings.sent3: The epidemiological research shed light on the factors influencing public health.
meanings.sent4: His epidemiological approach to understanding illnesses was both thorough and insightful.
meanings.sent5: The epidemiological study uncovered surprising connections between diet and disease.
